lyrics:
And another one bites the dust
Oh, why can I not conquer love?
And I might′ve thought that we were one

Wanted to fight this war without weapons

And I wanted it, and I wanted it bad
But there were so many red flags
Now another one bites the dust
Yeah, let's be clear I′ll trust no one

You did not break me

I'm still fighting for peace

I've got thick skin and an elastic heart
But your blade it might be too sharp
I′m like a rubber band until you pull too hard
I may snap and I move fast
But you won′t see me fall apart

'Cause I′ve got an elastic heart

I've got an elastic heart
Yeah, I′ve got an elastic heart

And I will stay up through the night
Let's be clear, won′t close my eyes
And I know that I can survive
I'll walk through fire to save my life

And I want it, I want my life so bad
I'm doing everything I can
Then another one bites the dust
It′s hard to lose a chosen one

You did not break me

I′m still fighting for peace

I've got thick skin and an elastic heart
But your blade it might be too sharp
I′m like a rubber band until you pull too hard
I may snap and I move fast
But you won't see me fall apart
′Cause I've got an elastic heart

I′ve got thick skin and an elastic heart
But your blade it might be too sharp
I'm like a rubber band until you pull too hard
I may snap and I move fast
But you won't see me fall apart

′Cause I′ve got an elastic heart

I've got thick skin and an elastic heart
But your blade it might be too sharp
I′m like a rubber band until you pull too hard
And I may snap and I move fast
But you won't see me fall apart

′Cause I've got an elastic heart

I′ve got an elastic heart
imageDescription: An image of a heart made of rubber bands, stretched to its limits but still holding strong. The rubber bands are taut and vibrant, representing resilience and determination. Despite the sharpness of the blade cutting through, the heart remains intact, symbolizing the ability to withstand pain and keep fighting.
